intro: Callicarpa tingwuensis, commonly known as the Tingwu beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that appear in the fall. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and slightly hairy on the underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and other wildlife, making it a valuable addition to ecological landscapes.
